3 Tools

The tools section includes a series of mixins, functions, placeholders, etc... to help developers to access settings with ease, do operations with different inputs and reuse concrete behaviors or properties.

3.1 tools.colors

A set of mixins and functions to work with colors.

egeo-is-coloured($colors)

@mixintested

Creates a set of modifier classes with the whole colors of a colors map passed as a parameter.

  • $colors - A Sass map of colors when the key is the name of the color and the value is the color itself.
  • $type - color/background
Compatibility untested.

egeo-get-color($color)

@functiontestedinternal

Get a specific color of the Sass map of colors $egeo-colors defined in settings.colors.

  • $color - The key of color we want to obtain from the Sass map of colors.

Dependencies

  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.

3.2 tools.typography

The typography tools includes a series of mixins and functions to work with typographies.

egeo-get-font($font-family: open-sans)

@functiontestedinternal

Return a value from the Sass map $egeo-font-families.

  • $font-family - The key of a pair key/value defined in the Sass map $egeo-font-families.

Usage

.test {
    font-family: egeo-get-font();
}

.test-2 {
    font-family: egeo-get-font(brandon-grotesque);
}

This code will generate:

.test {
    font-family: 'Open Sans';
}

.test-2 {
    font-family: 'Brandon Grotesque';
}
Compatibility untested.

egeo-get-font-size($font-size: medium)

@functiontestedinternal

Return a value from the Sass map $egeo-font-sizes.

  • $font-size - The key of a pair key/value defined in the Sass map $egeo-font-sizes.

Usage

.test {
    font-size: egeo-get-font-size();
}

.test-2 {
    font-size: egeo-get-font-size(small);
}

This code will generate:

.test {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.test-2 {
    font-size: .8rem;
}
Compatibility untested.

egeo-get-font-weight($font-weight: normal)

@functiontestedinternal

Return a value from the Sass map $egeo-font-weights.

  • $font-weight - The key of a pair key/value defined in the Sass map $egeo-font-weights.

Usage

.test {
    font-weight: egeo-get-font-weight();
}

.test-2 {
    font-weight: egeo-get-font-weight(bold);
}

This code will generate:

.test {
    font-weight: 400;
}

.test-2 {
    font-weight: 700;
}
Compatibility untested.

egeo-get-line-height($line-height: normal)

@functiontestedinternal

Return a value from the Sass map $egeo-line-heights.

  • $line-height - The key of a pair key/value defined in the Sass map $egeo-line-heights.

Usage

.test {
    line-height: egeo-get-line-height();
}

.test-2 {
    line-height: egeo-get-line-height(double);
}

This code will generate:

.test {
    line-height: 1em;
}

.test-2 {
    line-height: 2em;
}
Compatibility untested.

egeo-set-font-families()

@mixintestedinternal

Output a set of modifiers based on the $egeo-font-families map

Usage

.test {
    @include egeo-set-font-families;
}

This code will generate:

...

.test--brandon-grotesque {
    font-family: "Brandon Grotesque";
}

.test--open-sans {
    font-family: "Open Sans";
}

...
Compatibility untested.

egeo-set-font-sizes()

@mixintestedinternal

Output a set of modifiers based on the $egeo-font-sizes map

Usage

.test {
    @include egeo-set-font-sizes;
}

This code will generate:

...

.test--large {
    font-size: 1.2rem;
}

.test--medium {
    font-size: 1rem;
}

.test--small {
    font-size: 0.8rem;
}

...
Compatibility untested.

egeo-set-font-weights()

@mixintestedinternal

Output a set of modifiers based on the $egeo-font-weights map

Usage

.test {
    @include egeo-set-font-weights;
}

This code will generate:

...

.test--bold {
    font-weight: 700;
}

.test--semibold {
    font-weight: 500;
}

.test--normal {
    font-weight: 400;
}

...
Compatibility untested.

egeo-set-line-heights()

@mixintestedinternal

Output a set of modifiers based on the $egeo-line-heights map

Usage

.test {
    @include egeo-set-line-heights;
}

This code will generate:

...

.test--double {
    line-height: 2em;
}

.test--normal {
    line-height: 1.5em;
}

...
Compatibility untested.

Dependencies

  • tools.maps: This library uses the maps tools to create the modifiers.

3.3 tools.log

A logger library implemented over the version created by Hugo Giraudel in his article Using @error responsibly in Sass at sitepoint.

The log includes a mixin and a function with the same name. This is a hack needed to allow the log can be called from a function due to Sass doesn't allow calling mixins inside functions.

Note: This module cannot be tested due to the current systems of testing for Sass doesn't allow to test console outputs or compilation breaks.

Variables

var default desc
$egeo-log-debug
 No
A constant value used by the log methods to say to the log method that we want to show a debug message in the console.
$egeo-log-warn
 No
A constant value used by the log methods to say to the log method that we want to show a warn message in the console.
$egeo-log-error
 No
A constant value used by the log methods to say to the log method that we want to show an error message in the console.

Functions

egeo-log($message, $type: $egeo-log-debug) - the function

@functionuntestedinternal

The function log launches the directive @debug, @warn or @error depending on the parameter $type passed to the function. It detects if the directive @error is supported (Sass 3.3+) and provides an alternative for lower versions.

parameters
default value
 desc
$message
 No
The message we want to show in the console.
$type
 $egeo-log-debug
The type of message we want to show in the console. It could be have the value of one of the variables pre-defined: $egeo-log-debug, @log-warn or @log-error.

Usage

If we want to use the logger inside a function we have to use a hack due to the Sass limitations. We should have a code like the one below:

@function myFunction() {
    ...
    @if @log('My log message', $egeo-log-error) {}
    ...
}
Compatibility untested.

egeo-log($message, $type: $egeo-log-debug) - the mixin

@mixinuntestedinternal

Does exactly the same than the function but you can call it like showed in the Usage section.

parameters
default value
 desc
$message
 No
The message we want to show in the console.
$type
 $egeo-log-debug
The type of message we want to show in the console. It could be have the value of one of the variables pre-defined: $egeo-log-debug, @log-warn or @log-error.

Usage

...
@include egeo-log('My log message', $egeo-log-error);
...
Compatibility untested.

3.4 tools.layers

A set of functions and mixins to work with layers (z-index).

egeo-get-layer($layer)

@functiontestedinternal

Return a value from the Sass map $egeo-layers.

  • $layer - The key of a pair key/value defined in the Sass map $egeo-layers.

Usage

.test {
    @include egeo-get-layer(ontop);
}

This code will generate:

...

.test {
    z-index: 10;
}

...
Compatibility untested.

Dependencies

  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.

3.5 tools.maps

Functions and mixins to help work with Sass maps.

egeo-bem-modifiers-from-map($map, $css-property)

@mixintestedinternal

Create a BEM modifier class from the inner class that contains the mixin using the keys of the map passed as parameter as the --name and the values as the value of the $css-property.

  • $map - A Sass map with pairs key/value.
  • $css-property - The name of the CSS property which will change in the modifiers.

Usage

$my-map: (
    large: 1.5rem;
    normal: 1rem;
    small: .8rem;
)

.my-class {
        @include egeo-bem-modifiers-from-map($my-map, font-size);
}

This sample will generate this CSS code.

.my-class--large {
    font-size: 1.5rem;
}

.my-class--normal {
    font-size: 1rem;
}
.my-class--small {
    font-size: .8rem;
}
Compatibility untested.

Dependencies

  • tools.log: This library uses the logger tool to show debug info.
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
